free: #e The SaiSiyat people did not know how to weave before.
#c 從前賽夏人不會（用竹架子？）織布。
#e It was Kathethel who taught (them) weaving.
#c 據說織衣服是以前雷神教的。
#n 'obay mina rima' 'oemalep 'Obay是要去打獵; mina sa 也可以
#n Note: Obay is going hunting; mina sa is also acceptable.
#e Where does Kathethel come from?
#c 為此雷神從哪兒來呢？
#e The SaiSiyats go hunting in the woods.
#c 據說賽夏人去 ... ... 獵人去山上。
#n Note: kama-'alep <kama-hunt> hunter
#e Ten persons went hunting. The hunt lasted for one day.
#c 有十個人去打一整天的獵。
#e Upon their return, they saw the rice in the pot has been cooked.
#c 回到工寮(沒有人)，卻看見鍋子裡有飯 ... ... 在鍋子裡也有燒好的飯。
#e Who came to cook the rice?
#c 就是說這個 ... ... 誰來到山上來煮這頓飯呢？
#e Their workplace is close to the river.
#c 他們在工寮裡，很接近河川。
#n Note 1 : A: hayza ay ka ralom ray ba:la?
#n B:'iya ralom
#n A: 河裡面有水嗎?
#n B: 有水
#n A: Is there water in the river?
#n B: There is water.
#n Note 2: 'obay Somarak ka 'iyaralomon
#n Obay 掉到有水的地方
#n Obay fell into a place filed with water.
#n Note 3: Ni 'obay hi 'ataw ka 'oeboes 'iyaralomon
#n Ataw 的口袋被 Obay 裝水
#n Obay filled Ataw's pocket with water.
#e One of the elders was left to guard the place and watch who would come to cook the rice. The hunters left.
#c 讓一個老人在這裡站崗，看看到底是誰來給獵人煮飯。
#n ka-kita' 注意看 互相看 look at each other
#n IU#22 hini 可用 rini; IU#22 rini is acceptable
#n ya:o miyalawa' hi 'obay 我監視 'Obay; I am checking on 'Obay
#e In the evening, the elder saw a very young lady come out from the sea and saw her cook.
#c 晚上的時候，果真看到一位非常年輕的女子，一下子從海 ... ... 從水裡出來，走來走去燒飯。
#e When the lady finished cooking, she prepared to leave.
#c (那位女子)煮完了，準備要跑回去時。
#n minaSoka' hi 'obay 'am lobih ila taew'an Obay準備要回去了嗎? Note: Is Obay preparing to go back?
#e The elder blocked her way and she was not able to pass through.
#c 老人用標槍擋住, (她就)無法通過那個。
#e The elder talked to her and asked her where she was from.
#c 老人跟她談話, 問她從哪裡來。
#n 'inay 'ino' 哪裡回來
#n AF: paehraerang
#n yao kayngi' maeraehrang ki sia 我不要跟他商量
#n yao kayngi' maeraehrang nisia 我不要替他商量
#n Note:'inay 'ino' where from?
#n AF: paehraerang
#n I don't want to discuss with him.
#n I don't want to discuss for him.
#e At night, the hunters returned home.
#c 那天晚上，獵人回來了。
#e The dog arrived home ahead and wagged its tail.
#c 狗先來，來到那裡。
#e The hunters patted the dog and said,
#c （獵人）拍拍那條狗,說道：
#e What is the matter?
#c 怎麼這麼喘呢？
#n yao 'okik kihngap: 我沒有喘氣
#n Note: yao 'okik kihngap: I am not panting
#e The dog farted.
#c 狗(被打到)放屁。
#e The lady broke out laughing and agreed to talk.
#c 那小姑娘笑了。大家跟她商量，她就答應了。
#e (She kept asking) I am still young.
#c (她一直問)像我這樣還年輕。
#e My father instructed me to teach people how to weave.
#c 我爸爸叫我去教編織的方法。
#e There came more hunters.
#c 來很多人。
#e The hunters wanted a young man to marry the young lady.
#c 打獵的人回來，談論說，這個小姐和年輕的男生，要讓他們結婚。
#e The young man who has not yet married agreed to get married with her.
#c 允許他們的婚事。
#e It has been a long time after they got married.
#c 結婚後過了很久。
#e After getting married for a long time, the woman asked to go home to her parents' house.
#c 結婚後很久，想要回娘家。
#n '-in-kahoel-an '<pfv>-KAHOEL –loc.nmz' 娘家
#n Note : '-in-kahoel-an '<pfv>-KAHOEL –loc.nmz'  maiden's house-loc.nmz
#e Her husband wanted to go with her.
#c 那個年輕人也要跟著去。
#e They saw her beautiful house under the water.
#c 看到在水裡有很漂亮的家。
#e The woman had weaved many kinds of clothes for she knew how to weave. The man said he liked girls who knew how to weave.
#c 那女人已經織了很多衣服, 因為她知道如何編織。(那男生)說我很欣賞很會編織的年輕女孩子。
#e It would have been good if the SaiSiyat people learned to weave.
#c 賽夏族假如會編織的話是最好不過。
#e They returned to the SaiSiyat tribe.
#c 回去賽夏族那邊。
#e And she taught them how to weave.
#c 去教導編織的方法。
#e She taught the first batch of weavers and they learned how to weave.
#c 先教編織法, 有很多人學會了。
#e After she taught them weaving, there was another batch of students and she taught them to weave also.
#c 她教完他們編織後, 還有其他人要教。
#e The first batch of learners did not teach the next batch of learners some skills.
#c 先學過的人有隱藏技術，沒教後學的人。
#e They hid some weaving skills from the students, so they held a competition to see who had better weaving skills.
#c 用雷女神編織的技術，先給學的人測驗，再比賽。
#e The first batch of students did not teach everything to the second batch of students.
#c 第一批的學生沒有把所有的技巧教給第二批的學生。
#e They hid some techniques.
#c 他們有把技術藏起來。
#e They did not teach them all the techniques.
#c 他們沒有把所有的技術教給他們。
#e The competition director wanted them to compete with each other.
#c 裁判希望他們正式比賽。
#n ita 'aynola' 我們來比賽
#n Note: Let us have a contest. Let us compete.
#e To see if they have learned how to weave.
#c 看看學會了嗎？
#e The first batch of students did not teach everything to the second batch of students and concealed the techniques from them.
#c 第一批的學生沒有把所有的技巧教給第二批的學生, 他們有把技術藏起來。
#n tasi'amoeten 完全學到
#n Note: tasi'amoeten learned everything
#e The first batch of students hated Kathethel.
#c 先學的人開始記恨雷女。
#e Kathethel was ordered by her father to go (to teach Atayal).
#c 那個雷女被爸爸叫去。
#e (She could) even teach Saypapa:as (Atayal).
#c (說她連)泰雅族也可以教。
#e Kathethel was instructed by her father to teach the Atayals as well as the SaiSiyats so they could learn the techniques of weaving.
#c 雷女被她爸爸派去教泰雅族以及賽夏族, (這樣)他們就可以都全部學會。
#e They have finished weaving.
#c 他們編織結束。
#e They finished competing.
#c 他們比賽結束。
#e The first batch did not want the second batch of students to learn the secrets of weaving.
#c 第一批的學生不希望第二批的學生學會織布的秘訣。
#e (Kathethel was) hated by the first batch of students.
#c (雷女)被先學的人討厭。
#e They hated that Kathethel.
#c 他們討厭雷女。
#e Kathethel felt bad and she wanted to go home.
#c 雷女心情不好, 想要回家了。
#e Kathethel and her husband had been together for three years and they had a child.
#c 雷女和她的先生在一起三年了, 他們有一個小孩。
#e I wanted to go home. I don't want to stay here.
#c 我要回家了. 我不要留在這裡了。
#e I have taught you and you have learned to weave.
#c 我已經全部教你們學會了。
#e I will now return home.
#c 我現在要回家了。
#e What shall we do with this child? Let's cut him in half.
#c 這個小孩我們要怎麼辦? 我們把他切成兩半吧。
#e The husband was asked to make a decision.
#c 丈夫被要求作決定, 想辦法。
#e How do we cut him in half?
#c 要怎麼分成兩份？
#n Sia tiroSa' 他在把東西切成兩份
#n sitiroSa' 把東西分成兩半給兩個人
#n Note: Sia tiroSa'  He is (slicing/cutting something) into two.
#n sitiroSa' (slicing/cutting something) into two (to give to two people)
#e Kathethel cut his head in two.
#c 那個小孩子的頭被(雷)女切成兩半。
#e And tossed the head into the water.
#c 然後丟到水中。
#e The child's body was given to the husband.
#c 那個身體就給男人。
#e They decided to meet after a week.
#c 過了一星期之後就來碰面。
#e The child's head given to the woman doesn't have a body anymore, but it has grown taller.
#c 給女人的小孩頭沒有身體, 可是它有長高。
#e The man was given the child's body without a head.
#c 給男人的小孩身體沒有頭。
#e The body has rotted; it did not have any flesh, and was already dead.
#c 身體腐爛了; 沒有肉, 已經死了。
#e Weaving was taught by Biwa'.
#c 織布法是雷女教的。
#e The young people knew how to weave because Biwa' taught them.
#c 年輕人知道如何織布是因為雷女教的。
#e Both Atayals and SaiSiyats learned how to weave.
#c 泰雅族和賽夏族都學會了織布的方法。
#e It was at first Kathethel who taught the people how to weave.
#c 是雷神最早教人們織布的方法。
#e My story ends here.
#c 我的故事就到這裡。
